hints.content:
Barry Bee pollinated $\greenD{27}$ flowers.  How many pictures are above Barry on the picture graph?


[[☃ image 1]]

$\blueD3$ pictures are above Barry.  

$\blueD3 \times \,\maroonD{?} = \greenD{27}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Bee and the vertical axis labeled Number of flowers pollinated. Each Bee is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Barry, Bumbly, Betty, and Bertie. The number of flowers pollinated is represented by the number of pictures of flowers plotted on the graph. Barry is represented by 3 pictures of flowers, Bumbly is represented by 7 pictures of flowers, Betty is represented by 6 pictures of flowers, and Bertie is represented by 5 pictures of flowers. 3 pictures of flowers above Barry are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 3 at the top. !

hints.content:
$\blueD3 \times \maroonD{9} = \greenD{27}$

Let's see if $\maroonD{9} $ works for the other bees.

[[☃ image 1]]

Bee  || Number of flowers pollinated
:- | :-: | :-: 
Barry| $\blueD3  \times \maroonD{9} = \greenD{27}$| $\greenD{27}$ 
Bumbly |$\gray7 \times \maroonD{9} = \greenD{63}$| $\greenD{63}$   
Betty| $\purpleC6  \times \maroonD{9} = \greenD{54}$| $\greenD{54}$ 
Bertie| $\redC5  \times \maroonD{9} = \greenD{45}$| $\greenD{45}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Bee and the vertical axis labeled Number of flowers pollinated. Each Bee is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Barry, Bumbly, Betty, and Bertie. The number of flowers pollinated is represented by the number of pictures of flowers plotted on the graph. Barry is represented by 3 pictures of flowers, Bumbly is represented by 7 pictures of flowers, Betty is represented by 6 pictures of flowers, and Bertie is represented by 5 pictures of flowers. 7 pictures of flowers above Bumbly are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 7 at the top. 6 pictures of flowers above Betty are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 6 at the top. 5 pictures of flowers above Bertie are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 5 at the top. !

hints.content:
On the picture graph, each

[[☃ image 1]]

equals $\maroonD{9} $ flowers.

question.content:
Barry Bee and his bee friends love to pollinate flowers! They created a chart and a picture graph to show how many flowers each of them pollinated today. 


Bee  | Number of flowers pollinated   
:- | :-: 
Barry | $27$ 
Bumbly | $63$ 
Betty | $54$ 
Bertie | $45$ 


[[☃ image 1]]

 

[[☃ image 2]]

**On the picture graph, each**

[[☃ image 3]]

**equals [[☃ input-number 2]] flowers.**

options.alt: A picture of a flower equals question mark flowers. !

A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Bee and the vertical axis labeled Number of flowers pollinated. Each Bee is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Barry, Bumbly, Betty, and Bertie. The number of flowers pollinated is represented by the number of pictures of flowers plotted on the graph. Barry is represented by 3 pictures of flowers, Bumbly is represented by 7 pictures of flowers, Betty is represented by 6 pictures of flowers, and Bertie is represented by 5 pictures of flowers. !
